intro: Symphorema grossum, commonly known as the broad-leafed symphorema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically broad and elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers, which are followed by woody capsules containing the seeds. Symphorema grossum is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
